Name: DynamoDBProvisionedThroughput
Documentation:
Describes a set of provisioned throughput values for an AWS::DynamoDB::Table resource. DynamoDB uses these capacity units to allocate sufficient resources to provide the requested throughput.
For a complete discussion of DynamoDB provisioned throughput values, see Specifying Read and Write Requirements in the DynamoDB Developer Guide.

Parameters.Name: ReadCapacityUnits
Parameters.Documentation: Sets the desired minimum number of consistent reads of items (up to 1KB in size) per second for the specified table before Amazon DynamoDB balances the load.

Parameters.Name: WriteCapacityUnits
Parameters.Documentation: Sets the desired minimum number of consistent writes of items (up to 1KB in size) per second for the specified table before Amazon DynamoDB balances the load.
